results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (November 2008)
results.brief_description: These eight Digital Stories were created by members of the general public in Melbourne, Victoria. Mostly concerned with the concept of home, these eight different people provide a variety of perspectives.
results.description: These eight Digital Stories were created by members of the general public in Melbourne, Victoria. Mostly concerned with the concept of home, these eight different people provide a variety of perspectives.
description_for_label: These eight Digital Stories were created by members of the general public in Melbourne, Victoria. Mostly concerned with the concept of home, these eight different people provide a variety of perspectives.

results.title: The Ties that bind...
results.brief_description: Infuriated, exaggerated and invigourated. Natasha dedicates this Digital Story to the memory of her godfather, a man equally infuriating and lovable, and the bond they share.
results.description: Infuriated, exaggerated and invigourated. Natasha dedicates this Digital Story to the memory of her godfather, a man equally infuriating and lovable, and the bond they share.

results.title: The Soul of St Kilda
results.brief_description: Like some other residents, Meyer believes that St Kilda Town Hall is the heart of the community. He takes us through the rich history that is on display on the walls of this great building.
results.description: Like some other residents, Meyer believes that St Kilda Town Hall is the heart of the community. He takes us through the rich history that is on display on the walls of this great building.

results.title: See me
results.brief_description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.
results.description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.
description_for_label: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.

results.title: My first farewell
results.creator_credit: Angela Jones, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Angela Jones recalls a time when her daily activities caused her to feel a sense of shame and self consciousness that she would never like to experience again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Angela Jones, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Dream to create a home
results.creator_credit: Wendy Walters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wendy Walters and her group of passionate people set about building a home for ninety people in Mill Park, Victoria. Through the dreams and idealism is frustration at the struggle to make this building home for so many different people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Walters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Wendy Walters and her group of passionate people set about building a home for ninety people in Mill Park, Victoria. Through the dreams and idealism is frustration at the struggle to make this building home for so many different people.

results.title: Allan's "Westella"
results.creator_credit: Bob Barber, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The sad occassion of the sale of the beloved family farm “Westella” gives Bob Barber cause to reflect on the times there. It was at “Westella” that Barber learnt many things about running farm, and where he could always get a feed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Barber, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: The sad occassion of the sale of the beloved family farm “Westella” gives Bob Barber cause to reflect on the times there. It was at “Westella” that Barber learnt many things about running farm, and where he could always get a feed.

results.title: Love : earned or learned
results.creator_credit: Paul O'Toole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Paul O’Toole’s children are the catalyst for love in his family. Having never experienced unconditional love with his own dad, O’Toole has found that love with his own children. They also lead him on many adventures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul O’Toole, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Paul O’Toole’s children are the catalyst for love in his family. Having never experienced unconditional love with his own dad, O’Toole has found that love with his own children. They also lead him on many adventures.

results.title: Safe harbours
results.brief_description: Herself an immigrant, Karen Adams reflects on how policies and attitudes have changed towards immigrants and, in particular, refugees. A memorial at Otaki reminds her of the potential for hospitality and the dangerous journey that refugees take in the desperate search for safe harbours.
results.description: Herself an immigrant, Karen Adams reflects on how policies and attitudes have changed towards immigrants and, in particular, refugees. A memorial at Otaki reminds her of the potential for hospitality and the dangerous journey that refugees take in the desperate search for safe harbours.
description_for_label: Herself an immigrant, Karen Adams reflects on how policies and attitudes have changed towards immigrants and, in particular, refugees. A memorial at Otaki reminds her of the potential for hospitality and the dangerous journey that refugees take in the desperate search for safe harbours.

results.title: We shall remember them
results.creator_credit: John Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: John Thompson remembers the generations of soldiers that have passed through the Australian Light Horse Memorial Park in Seymour. While honouring their memory, he also welcomes the restoration of the park to create a place of beauty for all future Australians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: John Thompson remembers the generations of soldiers that have passed through the Australian Light Horse Memorial Park in Seymour. While honouring their memory, he also welcomes the restoration of the park to create a place of beauty for all future Australians.
